meanings.definition: A noncommissioned officer in the army or air force.
meanings.sent1: The sergeants led the troops into battle.
meanings.sent2: The sergeants trained the new recruits at the military base.
meanings.sent3: The sergeants organized a surprise drill to test the soldiers' readiness.
meanings.sent4: The sergeants were the backbone of the army, guiding and supporting the soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sergeants in their uniforms left a lasting impression on the recruits.

meanings.definition: A police officer ranking below a lieutenant.
meanings.sent1: The sergeants patrolled the streets to ensure safety in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The sergeants investigated the crime scene for any clues.
meanings.sent3: The sergeants jokingly argued about who would get the last donut in the break room.
meanings.sent4: The sergeants' presence in the community was like a shield against criminal activities.
meanings.sent5: The sergeants' dedication to upholding the law inspired trust among the citizens.
